<h2><a name="why-we-care">Why We Care</a></h2>
:::

::::: {#care-callout-1 .g-col-lg-6 .g-col-md-6 .g-col-sm-12}
:::: {.callout-tip icon="false"}
## {{< bi people-fill >}} 476,000

CDC estimates that approximately 476,000 Americans are diagnosed and treated for Lyme disease each year, but only a fraction of cases are reported through routine national surveillance.

<p style="margin-top:1.8rem;">

Source: [US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention](https://www.cdc.gov/lyme/data-research/facts-stats/index.html){target="_blank"}

::: flower-1
:::

</p>
::::
:::::

::::: {#care-callout-2 .g-col-lg-6 .g-col-md-6 .g-col-sm-12}
:::: {.callout-tip icon="false"}
## {{< bi globe-americas >}} 50+

Lyme disease positivity rates have increased, and positive tests have been observed in all 50 US states and the District of Columbia. But Lyme disease is not just a US problem. Lyme and other tickborne diseases are found worldwide.

<p style="margin-top:1.8rem;">

Source: [Quest Diagnostics](https://doi.org/10.1093/ajcp/aqz030){target="_blank"}, [Pathogens](https://doi.org/10.3390/pathogens12101258){target="_blank"}

::: flower-2
:::

</p>
::::
:::::

::::: {#care-callout-3 .g-col-lg-6 .g-col-md-6 .g-col-sm-12}
:::: {.callout-tip icon="false"}
## {{< bi heart-pulse-fill >}} \$1.3 billion

Patients diagnosed with Lyme disease on average have nearly \$3,000 higher annual health care costs, which adds up to a \$712 million â€“ \$1.3 billion burden on the US health care system each year.

<p style="margin-top:1.8rem;">

Source: [John Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health](https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0116767){target="_blank"}

::: flower-3
:::

</p>
::::
:::::

::::: {#care-callout-4 .g-col-lg-6 .g-col-md-6 .g-col-sm-12}
:::: {.callout-tip icon="false"}
## {{< bi search-heart>}} \$1,070

Research for improved prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of Lyme disease lags other diseases. US federal funding per new reported case of (\$1,070) is a fraction of that for HIV/AIDS (\$97,648) and hepatitis C (\$47,522).

<p style="margin-top:1.8rem;">

Source: [Tickborne Disease Working Group](https://www.hhs.gov/sites/default/files/tbdwg-report-to-congress-2018.pdf){target="_blank"}

::: flower-4
:::

</p>

<h2><a name="check-your-risk">Check Your Risk</a></h2>

<ul>

<li>Do you live, work, or travel in the US or Canada? Use the map to check if you are within the geographic range of Lyme and other tickborne diseases.</li>

<li>Use the <img id="search-icon"> icon to search for a location.</li>

<li>Use the <img id="layers-icon"> icon to toggle on / off different tickborne diseases.</li>

<li>Risk areas are identified from recent county (US) and postal code (Canada) data from [CDC](https://www.cdc.gov/ticks/data-research/facts-stats/geographic-distribution-of-tickborne-disease-cases.html){target="_blank"} and [Public Health Agency of Canada](https://www.canada.ca/en/public-health/services/diseases/lyme-disease/surveillance-lyme-disease.html#a4){target="_blank"}.</li>

</ul>
:::

::: {#risk-map .g-col-lg-6 .g-col-sm-12}
```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(leaflet)
library(leaflet.extras)
library(sf)
provinces <- st_read("data/states-provinces/provinces.shp", quiet = TRUE)
states <- st_read("data/states-provinces/states.shp", quiet = TRUE)
lyme_canada <- st_read("data/home-risk-map/canada_lyme.shp", quiet = TRUE)
lyme_usa <- st_read("data/home-risk-map/usa_lyme.shp", quiet = TRUE)
anaplasmosis <- st_read("data/home-risk-map/usa_anaplasmosis.shp", quiet = TRUE)
babesiosis <- st_read("data/home-risk-map/usa_babesiosis.shp", quiet = TRUE)
e_chaffeensis <- st_read("data/home-risk-map/usa_ehrlichia_chaffeensis_ehrlichiosis.shp", quiet = TRUE)
e_ewingii <- st_read("data/home-risk-map/usa_ehrlichia_ewingii_ehrlichiosis.shp", quiet = TRUE)
sfr <- st_read("data/home-risk-map/usa_spotted_fever_rickettsiosis.shp", quiet = TRUE)
tularemia <- st_read("data/home-risk-map/usa_tularemia.shp", quiet = TRUE)
undetermined <- st_read("data/home-risk-map/usa_undetermined_ehrlichiosis_anaplasmosis.shp", quiet = TRUE)
leaflet() %>%
  addMapPane(name = "maplabels", zIndex = 420) %>%
  addProviderTiles(provider = "CartoDB.PositronNoLabels") %>%
  addProviderTiles(provider = "CartoDB.PositronOnlyLabels",
                   options = leafletOptions(pane = "maplabels")) %>%
  fitBounds(-139.05220, 24.49813, -52.58230, 62.59359) %>%
  addResetMapButton() %>%
  addSearchOSM(options = searchOptions(collapsed = TRUE,
                                       position = "topright",
                                       hideMarkerOnCollapse = TRUE)) %>%
  addPolygons(data = lyme_usa,
              stroke = FALSE,
              fillColor = "#59a14f",
              fillOpacity = .5,
              group = "<img id='lyme-icon'> Lyme Disease") %>%
  addPolygons(data = lyme_canada,
              stroke = FALSE,
              fillColor = "#59a14f",
              fillOpacity = .5,
              group = "<img id='lyme-icon'> Lyme Disease") %>%
  addPolygons(data = anaplasmosis,
              stroke = FALSE,
              fillColor = "#4e79a7",
              fillOpacity = .5,
              group = "<img id='anaplasmosis-icon'> Anaplasmosis") %>%
  addPolygons(data = babesiosis,
              stroke = FALSE,
              fillColor = "#f28e2b",
              fillOpacity = .5,
              group = "<img id='babesiosis-icon'> Babesiosis") %>%
  addPolygons(data = e_chaffeensis,
              stroke = FALSE,
              fillColor = "#e15759",
              fillOpacity = .5,
              group = "<img id='e-chaffeensis-icon'> Ehrlichiosis (E. chaffeensis)") %>%
  addPolygons(data = e_ewingii,
              stroke = FALSE,
              fillColor = "#76b7b2",
              fillOpacity = .5,
              group = "<img id='e-ewingii-icon'> Ehrlichiosis (E. ewingii)") %>%
  addPolygons(data = sfr,
              stroke = FALSE,
              fillColor = "#edc948",
              fillOpacity = .5,
              group = "<img id='sfr-icon'> Spotted Fever Rickettsiosis") %>%
  addPolygons(data = tularemia,
              stroke = FALSE,
              fillColor = "#b07aa1",
              fillOpacity = .5,
              group = "<img id='tularemia-icon'> Tularemia") %>%
  addPolygons(data = undetermined,
              stroke = FALSE,
              fillColor = "#9c755f",
              fillOpacity = .5,
              group = "<img id='undetermined-icon'> Undetermined Ehrlichiosis / Anaplasmosis") %>%
  addPolygons(data = provinces,
              color = "#000000",
              stroke = TRUE,
              fillColor = NA,
              fillOpacity = 0,
              weight = .5,
              opacity = 1,
              label = ~PRENAME) %>%
  addPolygons(data = states,
              color = "#000000",
              stroke = TRUE,
              fillColor = NA,
              fillOpacity = 0,
              weight = .5, 
              opacity = 1,
              label = ~NAME) %>%
  addLayersControl(position = "bottomright",
                   options = layersControlOptions(collapsed = TRUE),
                   overlayGroups = c("<img id='lyme-icon'> Lyme Disease",
                                     "<img id='anaplasmosis-icon'> Anaplasmosis",
                                     "<img id='babesiosis-icon'> Babesiosis",
                                     "<img id='e-chaffeensis-icon'> Ehrlichiosis (E. chaffeensis)",
                                     "<img id='e-ewingii-icon'> Ehrlichiosis (E. ewingii)",
                                     "<img id='sfr-icon'> Spotted Fever Rickettsiosis",
                                     "<img id='tularemia-icon'> Tularemia",
                                     "<img id='undetermined-icon'> Undetermined Ehrlichiosis / Anaplasmosis")
  ) %>%
  hideGroup(c("<img id='anaplasmosis-icon'> Anaplasmosis",
              "<img id='babesiosis-icon'> Babesiosis",
              "<img id='e-chaffeensis-icon'> Ehrlichiosis (E. chaffeensis)",
              "<img id='e-ewingii-icon'> Ehrlichiosis (E. ewingii)",
              "<img id='sfr-icon'> Spotted Fever Rickettsiosis",
              "<img id='tularemia-icon'> Tularemia",
              "<img id='undetermined-icon'> Undetermined Ehrlichiosis / Anaplasmosis"))
```
